TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ActivityTrackingLocation extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Defines an activity-qualified location that corresponds to an activity status event in the potential execution path of a root workflow instance. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Whenever the execution status of an activity changes, the workflow instance emits an activity status event to the runtime tracking infrastructure. The runtime tracking infrastructure can send the tracking service an <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingRecord> whenever an activity status event occurs. Usually, a tracking service is not interested in every activity status event that occurs in the workflow instance, but only in activity status events associated with certain kinds of activities at specified locations in the workflow instance. An <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation> defines the matching parameters for such a location by specifying a reference activity type, a set of activity status change events, and a set of conditions that can more precisely qualify an instance or instances of the reference activity type.
> [!NOTE] > A single <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation> may refer to more than one actual location in the potential execution path of a workflow instance.
You add <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation> objects to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackPoint.MatchingLocations%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackPoint.ExcludedLocations%2A> in order to define the match parameters for an <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackPoint> in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile>.
You must specify the reference activity type to be matched by setting either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A>.
You may set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedTypes%2A> to specify interest in activities derived from the reference activity type.
You may add <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus> values to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A> to specify the activity status events to be matched.
You may add <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition> objects to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A> to specify interest in the reference activity type only for specific conditions. For example, you can specify interest in only a particular named instance of the reference activity type.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you use the default constructor and you do not explicitly set either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> in your code, then if a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfileSerializer> is later used on your tracking profile an exception will be thrown.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing`).| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingConditionCollection>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedTypes%2A>|`false`.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string activityTypeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The unqualified name of the common language runtime (CLR) type of an activity.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified activity name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must specify the unqualified name of the reference activity type. For example, the unqualified name of the CLR type of a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activity is "CodeActivity". <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> is set to `activityTypeName`.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A>|The unqualified name specified by `activityTypeName` of the reference activity type.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing`).| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingConditionCollection>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedTypes%2A>|`false`.|

Docs.exception: is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> is set to `activityType`.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A>|The reference activity type specified by `activityType`.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingConditionCollection>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedTypes%2A>|`false`.|

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Type ^ ActivityType { Type ^ get(); void set(Type ^ value); };
member this.ActivityType : Type with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the common language runtime (CLR) type of the reference activity to be matched.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You must specify either the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation>. If you want to specify the reference activity type in a version-independent manner, use <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ActivityTypeName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ActivityTypeName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the unqualified name of the reference activity type for the location.
Docs.value: The unqualified name of the reference activity type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must specify the unqualified name of the reference activity type. For example, to specify the unqualified name of a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activity set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> to "CodeActivity".
<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> provides a much easier way to specify a reference activity type when you author a profile directly in XML. <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> also provides a version-independent way of referring to a reference activity type.
You must specify either the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Conditions As TrackingConditionCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of conditions that are used to qualify interest in the activity.
Docs.value: A that contains conditions that are used to qualify interest in the activity. The default is an empty collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A> to more precisely define the instance of the reference activity type to be matched. For example, if you want to match only <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activities with an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Name%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> equal to "MyCode", you can set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> to"CodeActivity" and add an <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition> to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A> that specifies that the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Name%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the activity instance must be equal to "MyCode".
Every <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingCondition> in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A> must be `true` and one of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus> values in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A> must be matched for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation> to be matched.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ExecutionStatusEvents As IList(Of ActivityExecutionStatus)

Docs.summary: Gets the list of activity status events that can be matched for this location.
Docs.value: A that contains one or more of the values. The default is an empty list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A> specifies the activity status events for which the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation> can be matched. One of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus> values in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.ExecutionStatusEvents%2A> must be matched and every <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingCondition> in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A> must be `true` for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation> to be matched. An empty list specifies that no events are to be matched.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MatchDerivedTypes { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.MatchDerivedTypes : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether activities derived from the reference activity type should be matched.
Docs.value: if activities derived from the reference activity type of the location should be matched; otherwise, . The default is .
